KnapsackGA

Safe HaskellNone
LanguageHaskell2010

GA

Description

General implementation of GA for the knapsack problem.

Synopsis
  • train :: String -> String -> Int -> Int -> IO Chromosome
  • firstGen :: [(Int, Int)] -> Int -> Int -> IO [Chromosome]
  • generateNextGen :: GA_Args -> Int -> Int -> IO [Chromosome] -> IO [Chromosome]

Documentation

train #

Arguments

:: String

Name of file containing weights.

-> String

Name of file containing values.

-> Int

Number of generations to train.

-> Int

Maximum amount of weight allowed.

-> IO Chromosome

Best solution from the last generation.

Main training function.

Sorts each generation and starts generating new one if amount of generations has not been reached.

firstGen #

Arguments

:: [(Int, Int)]

Database of (weight, value).

-> Int

Amount of solution in one generation.

-> Int

Maximum amount of weight allowed.

-> IO [Chromosome]

First generation.

Generate first random unsorted generation.

generateNextGen #

Arguments

:: GA_Args

Stores immutable arguments for generating next generation.

-> Int

Current number of generated memberrs of next generation.

-> Int

Amount of members to generate for next population.

-> IO [Chromosome]

Last generation.

-> IO [Chromosome]

Next generation.

Generate next generation using given crossover and mutation.
